remarks: In the Separation Scheme ~ zfauscl , we require that ` y ` not occur in ` ph ` (which can be generalized to "not be free in").  Here we show special cases of ` A ` and ` ph ` that result in a contradiction by violating this requirement.  (Contributed by NM, 8-Feb-2006.)
statement:
notzfaus.1 $e |- A = { (/) } $.
notzfaus.2 $e |- ( ph <-> -. x e. y ) $.
notzfaus $p |- -. E. y A. x ( x e. y <-> ( x e. A /\ ph ) ) $.
$d A x $.
